txt.en: 'We make a run for it on my mark.'
'Now!'
Instance: The Ithil-stone
'We should be able to listen here if we remain hidden.'
'Where is Dulgabêth?!'
'Fear me, beasts!'
'The respect we get is not what we deserve!'
'Look! That orb on the the ground!
'Now is our chance to thwart these foes!'
'Looks like the odds are against you!'
'Riders approach! We must veer from the road, my friend!'
'The stone!'
'That was close!'
'Gar! Are you in league with these flying filths?!'
'Do you see that shining in the distance? What is that?!'
'I feed on the pain!'
'Oh, the torture you will receive!'
'Hiss! We have spent much time to retrieve the stone! Does the Black Word not care?!'
'What is this?!'
'You will pay for this intrusion. Hiss!'
'Hiss! How dare you defect! If I survive, you shall pay dearly, Olog!'
'Now that we have seen the stone, we can assure you the master will be pleased.'
Remaining hidden, you listen to the nearby conversation.
'Hmpf.'
'It seems to be atop that rock outcropping over there.'
'You have done well.'
'Ha ha ha, puny [placeholder]!'
'What do you suppose that is?'
'As we have said before, the Black Word is busy attending to other matters.'
'Now you will take the stone into the tower and place it within Dulgabêth's chamber where it shall remain safe.'
'They're getting away!'
'Do not tarry here long or you will regret challenging the word of Dulgabêth!'
'Forget these filth. I'd rather live for another day than serve The Black Word any longer!'
'Now we must leave, for the Black Word calls on our assistance.'
'Rawr!'
